security_audit.summary: Pure documentation-based skill definition with no executable code. All file operations scoped to .claude/memory/ directory. No network calls, no command execution, no environment access. Legitimate purpose-aligned capabilities only.

content.value_statement: Context loss between sessions wastes time re-explaining project history. This skill automatically records decisions, patterns, and task progress to enable seamless continuation of work across Claude sessions.
actual_capabilities: Stores session logs with completed tasks and file changes
Records architectural decisions with rationale in decisions.md
Captures project patterns and conventions in patterns.md
limitations: Requires Claude Code with hooks/Stop integration for automatic saving
Does not sync across different machines or users
Manual cleanup needed when logs become too large

use_cases.title: Continue multi-day projects
use_cases.description: Resume work on complex features across multiple sessions without re-explaining context

use_cases.title: Maintain decision records
use_cases.description: Document technical choices and their rationale for team reference and onboarding

use_cases.title: Track client project history
use_cases.description: Keep track of client project details and decisions between different work sessions

prompt_templates.title: Continue previous work
prompt_templates.prompt: What did we work on in the last session? What tasks are remaining?

prompt_templates.title: Review decisions
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the important decisions made for this project and why.

prompt_templates.title: Learn project patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: What patterns and conventions should I follow when writing code for this project?

prompt_templates.title: Get project overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me a summary of this project including tech stack and current phase.

output_examples.input: What did we work on last time?

best_practices: Use descriptive titles and tags in decisions.md for easy searching
Keep session-log.md focused on actionable items rather than full transcripts
Review and archive old sessions periodically to prevent file bloat
anti_patterns: Storing sensitive credentials or secrets in memory files
Committing session-log.md to version control (it contains temporary details)
Skipping decision documentation when making architectural choices

faq.question: Which Claude tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Claude Code is the primary tool. Works with Claude and Codex when hooks/Stop is configured.

faq.question: How much history can be stored?
faq.answer: No hard limit but files over 10MB may slow context loading. Manual cleanup recommended.

faq.question: Can I share memory between team members?
faq.answer: decisions.md and patterns.md should be shared. session-log.md and context.json should stay local.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Data stays local in .claude/memory/. No network calls or external access by design.

faq.question: Memory files are too large

faq.question: How is this different from global memory?
faq.answer: Session memory is project-specific. Global memory spans all projects. Use both together.
